learning_outcomes.description: Compare and contrast body plans of animals and appraise how these plans equip animals for life.
Explain concepts of origins and diversity of life forms.
Recognize different forms of animal associations and explain how these interactions relate to basic concepts in biodiversity.
Describe concepts of evolution and domestication of animals of veterinary significance.

assessments.task_description:
Assessment sequence consisting of six quizzes examining content from practical classes. The quizzes will be set in Inspera and will consist of 10 multiple response, text entry, matching/pairing, drag and drop, composite, hotspot and matching, short-answer, multiple choice, and/or inline choice questions.  The quizzes will be open for a duration of 5 days (minimum). Once the student starts the quiz in Inspera, they will have 20 mins to complete it before it closes. Students are required to use their own devices for these quizzes. See Assessment folder on Blackboard for links to Quizzes and further information.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The exam will examine material from covered up to and including Lecture 14. The exam will be Inspera and will consist of a mix of multiple response, text entry, matching/pairing, drag and drop, composite, hotspot and matching, short-answer, multiple choice, and/or inline choice questions. This will be a centrally timetabled on-campus invigilated examination hosted on Inspera. Students are required to use their own device for this exam.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment task will examine all lecture content from Lecture 14 to the last lecture of semester. The exam will be Inspera and will consist of a mix of multiple response, text entry, matching/pairing, drag and drop, composite, hotspot and matching, short-answer, multiple choice, and/or inline choice questions. This will be an on-campus invigilated examination hosted on Inspera in the central examination period. If this is not possible, the exam will be an invigilated online exam.  Students are required to use their own device for this exam. 

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.topic:
Practicals in Structure and Diversity

6 practicals spaced throughout the semester.

Prac 1, week 4 - Using microscopes

Prac 2, week 5 - Prokaryotes, Single celled Eukaryotes and animal health

Prac 3, week 7 - Animal Diversity and Body Plans

Prac 4, week 8 - Invertebrate Anatomy

Prac 5, week 10 - Mammalian organ systems

Prac 6, week 11 - The skeleton
